name: Assign Missing Categories
author: Stephanie Leary

sections.description: If you have converted categories to tags and are now left with a lot of posts that have no category assigned (that show up with ‘Uncategorized,’ unlinked, as the category under Posts), you can use this plugin to assign the default category to all those posts at once.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the files to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to Posts → Assign Missing Categories
sections.changelog:
1.2

  • stop using deprecated junk
  • clean the term cache after assigning posts
  • localized strings (July 29, 2011)

1.1

  • user capability check (August 3, 2009)

1.0

  • first release (November 17, 2008)

short_description: Assigns the default category to all posts that have no category after you've converted your categories to tags.
description: If you have converted categories to tags and are now left with a lot of posts that have no category assigned (that show up with ‘Uncategorized,’ unlinked, as the category under Posts), you can use this plugin to assign the default category to all those posts at once.
